summary: This document is an email chain from October 20, 2019, discussing logistical arrangements for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is in New York for a press event. An FBI Victim Services Division employee seeks clarification on whether the government-funded travel requires the victim to return on Thursday or if a Friday return is permissible, noting the victim has purchased her own ticket for Friday.

persons.name: Subject
persons.context: Appears to be forwarding an email chain regarding victim travel logistics on October 20, 2019.

events.title: Victim press event in New York
events.description: Several victims of Jeffrey Epstein are planning to hold a press event of their own in New York.

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein is in New York and, along with several other victims, is planning a press event on a Thursday.
The victim, assisted by the FBI Victim Services Division, is under the impression that government-funded travel requires her to return home on Thursday.
The victim purchased her own plane ticket for a Friday return, believing the government's return flight was only offered for Thursday.
An FBI employee seeks to clarify if return travel dates are flexible when using government funding, and if the victim's flight can be rebooked for Friday to avoid an unused government-paid ticket.
The email chain highlights logistical coordination between the FBI and victims regarding travel and expenses for court-related events.
